How to Install acpitail on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • acpitail

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install acpitail on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing acpitail on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall acpitail in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install acpitail, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install acpitail Using apt

To install acpitail in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install acpitail using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install acpitail

The installation of acpitail might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install acpitail Using apt-get

To install acpitail using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install acpitail.

sudo apt-get -y install acpitail

Install acpitail Using Synaptic

To install acpitail using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install acpitail on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for acpitail. This will display the acpitail package in the package window, now to install acpitail, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the acpitail package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of acpitail.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install acpitail Using aptitude

To install acpitail on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of acpitail.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install acpitail using the command aptitude install acpitail.

sudo aptitude -y install acpitail

How to Upgrade acpitail on debian

If you want to upgrade the acpitail package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade acpitail using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade acpitail to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade acpitail.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade acpitail sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade acpitail

Upgrade acpitail using Aptitude

To upgrade acpitail using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade acpitail.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade acpitail

Upgrade acpitail using Synaptic

To upgrade acpitail using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for acpitail, now right-click acpitail, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade acpitail just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall acpitail on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall acpitail from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just acpitail, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove acpitail

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of acpitail

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of acpitail you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge acpitail

Remove acpitail using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall acpitail using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for acpitail, right-click the acpitail package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall acpitail click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install acpitail on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade acpitail using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
